verses.verse: Ὁμοία <WG3664> Homoia like ( The Parable of the Workers) γάρ <WG1063> gar [“] For ἐστιν <WG1510> estin is ἡ <WG3588> hē the βασιλεία <WG932> basileia kingdom τῶν <WG3588> tōn of οὐρανῶν <WG3772> ouranōn heaven ἀνθρώπῳ <WG444> anthrōpō vvv οἰκοδεσπότῃ <WG3617> oikodespotē a landowner ὅστις <WG3748> hostis who ἐξῆλθεν <WG1831> exēlthen went out ἅμα <WG260> hama early in πρωῒ <WG4404> prōi [the] morning μισθώσασθαι <WG3409> misthōsasthai to hire ἐργάτας <WG2040> ergatas workers εἰς <WG1519> eis for τὸν <WG3588> ton - ἀμπελῶνα <WG290> ampelōna vineyard . αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his

συμφωνήσας <WG4856> symphōnēsas He agreed δὲ <WG1161> de - μετὰ <WG3326> meta [to pay] τῶν <WG3588> tōn - ἐργατῶν <WG2040> ergatōn [them] ἐκ <WG1537> ek for δηναρίου <WG1220> dēnariou a denarius ( A denarius was customarily a day’s wage for a laborer; similarly in verses 9, 10, and 13.) τὴν <WG3588> tēn the ἡμέραν <WG2250> hēmeran day ἀπέστειλεν <WG649> apesteilen [and] sent αὐτοὺς <WG846> autous them εἰς <WG1519> eis into τὸν <WG3588> ton - ἀμπελῶνα <WG290> ampelōna vineyard . αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai - ἐξελθὼν <WG1831> exelthōn he went out περὶ <WG4012> peri About τρίτην <WG5154> tritēn the third ὥραν <WG5610> hōran hour ( That is, about nine in the morning) εἶδεν <WG3708> eiden [and] saw ἄλλους <WG243> allous others ἑστῶτας <WG2476> hestōtas standing ἐν <WG1722> en in τῇ <WG3588> tē the ἀγορᾷ <WG58> agora marketplace ἀργούς <WG692> argous doing nothing .

καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἐκείνοις <WG1565> ekeinois - , εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen he said Ὑπάγετε <WG5217> Hypagete go καὶ <WG2532> kai also ὑμεῖς <WG4771> hymeis ‘ You εἰς <WG1519> eis into τὸν <WG3588> ton [my] ἀμπελῶνα <WG290> ampelōna vineyard , ’ καὶ <WG2532> kai ‘ and ὃ <WG3739> ho whatever ἐὰν <WG1437> ean . . . ᾖ <WG1510> ē is δίκαιον <WG1342> dikaion right . ’ δώσω <WG1325> dōsō I will pay ὑμῖν <WG4771> hymin you

οἱ <WG3588> hoi - δὲ <WG1161> de So ἀπῆλθον <WG565> apēlthon they went . Πάλιν <WG3825> Palin again δὲ <WG1161> de - ἐξελθὼν <WG1831> exelthōn He went out περὶ <WG4012> peri about ἕκτην <WG1623> hektēn [the] sixth [hour] καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐνάτην <WG1766> enatēn [the] ninth ὥραν <WG5610> hōran hour ( That is, about noon and again about three in the afternoon) ἐποίησεν <WG4160> epoiēsen [and] did ὡσαύτως <WG5615> hōsautōs the same thing .

Περὶ <WG4012> Peri About δὲ <WG1161> de - τὴν <WG3588> tēn the ἑνδεκάτην <WG1734> hendekatēn eleventh [hour] ( That is, about five in the afternoon; also in verse 9) ἐξελθὼν <WG1831> exelthōn he went out εὗρεν <WG2147> heuren [and] found ἄλλους <WG243> allous still others ἑστῶτας <WG2476> hestōtas standing [around] . καὶ <WG2532> kai - λέγει <WG3004> legei he asked αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois . . . . Τί <WG5101> Ti ‘ Why ὧδε <WG5602> hōde here ἑστήκατε <WG2476> hestēkate have you been standing ὅλην <WG3650> holēn all τὴν <WG3588> tēn - ἡμέραν <WG2250> hēmeran day [long] ἀργοί <WG692> argoi doing nothing ? ’

Λέγουσιν <WG3004> Legousin they answered αὐτῷ <WG846> autō . . . . Ὅτι <WG3754> Hoti ‘ Because οὐδεὶς <WG3762> oudeis no one ἡμᾶς <WG1473> hēmas us , ’ ἐμισθώσατο <WG3409> emisthōsato has hired Λέγει <WG3004> Legei So he told αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois them , Ὑπάγετε <WG5217> Hypagete go καὶ <WG2532> kai also ὑμεῖς <WG4771> hymeis ‘ You εἰς <WG1519> eis into τὸν <WG3588> ton [my] ἀμπελῶνα <WG290> ampelōna vineyard .’ ( BYZ and TR include and whatever is right, you shall receive.)

Ὀψίας <WG3798> Opsias evening δὲ <WG1161> de When γενομένης <WG1096> genomenēs came , λέγει <WG3004> legei said ὁ <WG3588> ho the κύριος <WG2962> kyrios owner τοῦ <WG3588> tou of the ἀμπελῶνος <WG290> ampelōnos vineyard τῷ <WG3588> tō to ἐπιτρόπῳ <WG2012> epitropō foreman , αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his Κάλεσον <WG2564> Kaleson ‘ Call τοὺς <WG3588> tous the ἐργάτας <WG2040> ergatas workers καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀπόδος <WG591> apodos pay ‹αὐτοῖς› <WG846> autois them τὸν <WG3588> ton [their] μισθόν <WG3408> misthon wages , ἀρξάμενος <WG756> arxamenos starting ἀπὸ <WG575> apo with τῶν <WG3588> tōn the ἐσχάτων <WG2078> eschatōn last [ones hired] ἕως <WG2193> heōs and moving on τῶν <WG3588> tōn to the πρώτων <WG4413> prōtōn first . ’

Καὶ* <WG2532> Kai - ἐλθόντες <WG2064> elthontes came [and] οἱ <WG3588> hoi [The workers who were hired] περὶ <WG4012> peri about τὴν <WG3588> tēn the ἑνδεκάτην <WG1734> hendekatēn eleventh ὥραν <WG5610> hōran hour ἔλαβον <WG2983> elabon received ἀνὰ <WG303> ana each δηνάριον <WG1220> dēnarion a denarius .

καὶ <WG2532> kai So when ἐλθόντες <WG2064> elthontes came , οἱ <WG3588> hoi the πρῶτοι <WG4413> prōtoi original [workers] ἐνόμισαν <WG3543> enomisan they assumed ὅτι <WG3754> hoti - πλεῖον <WG4119> pleion more . λήμψονται <WG2983> lēmpsontai they would receive καὶ <WG2532> kai But ἔλαβον <WG2983> elabon received τὸ <WG3588> to - ἀνὰ <WG303> ana each δηνάριον <WG1220> dēnarion a denarius . καὶ <WG2532> kai also αὐτοί <WG846> autoi of them

Λαβόντες <WG2983> Labontes On receiving [their pay] , δὲ <WG1161> de - ἐγόγγυζον <WG1111> egongyzon they began to grumble κατὰ <WG2596> kata against τοῦ <WG3588> tou the οἰκοδεσπότου <WG3617> oikodespotou landowner .

λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes they said , Οὗτοι <WG3778> Houtoi ‘ These οἱ <WG3588> hoi [men who were hired] ἔσχατοι <WG2078> eschatoi last μίαν <WG1520> mian only one ὥραν <WG5610> hōran hour , ’ ἐποίησαν <WG4160> epoiēsan worked καὶ <WG2532> kai ‘ and ἴσους <WG2470> isous equal αὐτοὺς <WG846> autous them ἡμῖν <WG1473> hēmin to us ἐποίησας <WG4160> epoiēsas you have made τοῖς <WG3588> tois who βαστάσασι <WG941> bastasasi have borne τὸ <WG3588> to the βάρος <WG922> baros burden τῆς <WG3588> tēs of the ἡμέρας <WG2250> hēmeras day . ’ καὶ <WG2532> kai and τὸν <WG3588> ton the καύσωνα <WG2742> kausōna scorching heat

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de But ἀποκριθεὶς <WG611> apokritheis he answered ἑνὶ <WG1520> heni one αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn of them εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen - , Ἑταῖρε <WG2083> Hetaire ‘ Friend , οὐκ <WG3756> ouk vvv ἀδικῶ <WG91> adikō I am not being unfair σε <WG4771> se to you . οὐχὶ <WG3780> ouchi vvv δηναρίου <WG1220> dēnariou on one denarius ? συνεφώνησάς <WG4856> synephōnēsas Did you not agree μοι <WG1473> moi with me

ἆρον <WG142> aron Take τὸ <WG3588> to [pay] σὸν <WG4674> son your καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὕπαγε <WG5217> hypage go . θέλω <WG2309> thelō I want δὲ <WG1161> de - τούτῳ <WG3778> toutō this τῷ <WG3588> tō - ἐσχάτῳ <WG2078> eschatō last [man] δοῦναι <WG1325> dounai to give ὡς <WG5613> hōs the same as καὶ <WG2532> kai [I gave] σοί <WG4771> soi you .

[ἢ] <WG2228> ē vvv οὐκ <WG3756> ouk vvv ἔξεστίν <WG1832> exestin Do I not have the right μοι <WG1473> moi . . . ὃ <WG3739> ho as θέλω <WG2309> thelō I please ποιῆσαι <WG4160> poiēsai to do ἐν <WG1722> en with τοῖς <WG3588> tois what [is] ἐμοῖς <WG1699> emois mine ? ἢ <WG2228> ē Or ὁ <WG3588> ho . . . ὀφθαλμός <WG3788> ophthalmos . . . σου <WG4771> sou . . . πονηρός <WG4190> ponēros envious ἐστιν <WG1510> estin are you ὅτι <WG3754> hoti because ἐγὼ <WG1473> egō I ἀγαθός <WG18> agathos generous ? ’ εἰμι <WG1510> eimi am

Οὕτως <WG3779> Houtōs So ἔσονται <WG1510> esontai will be οἱ <WG3588> hoi the ἔσχατοι <WG2078> eschatoi last πρῶτοι <WG4413> prōtoi first , καὶ <WG2532> kai and οἱ <WG3588> hoi the πρῶτοι <WG4413> prōtoi first ἔσχατοι <WG2078> eschatoi [will be] last .” ( BYZ and TR include For many are called, but few are chosen.)

( The Third Prediction of the Passion) ( ( 480 10:32-34 ; 490 18:31-34 )) ‹Καὶ <WG2532> Kai As ἀναβαίνων <WG305> anabainōn was going up ὁ› <WG3588> ho - Ἰησοῦς <WG2424> Iēsous Jesus εἰς <WG1519> eis to Ἱεροσόλυμα <WG2414> Hierosolyma Jerusalem , παρέλαβεν <WG3880> parelaben He took τοὺς <WG3588> tous the δώδεκα <WG1427> dōdeka twelve ‹μαθητὰς› <WG3101> mathētas disciples κατ’ <WG2596> kat’ aside ἰδίαν <WG2398> idian - καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐν <WG1722> en - τῇ <WG3588> tē - ὁδῷ <WG3598> hodō - εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen said αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois - ,

Ἰδοὺ <WG2400> Idou “ Look , ἀναβαίνομεν <WG305> anabainomen we are going up εἰς <WG1519> eis to Ἱεροσόλυμα <WG2414> Hierosolyma Jerusalem , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὁ <WG3588> ho the Υἱὸς <WG5207> Huios Son τοῦ <WG3588> tou - ἀνθρώπου <WG444> anthrōpou of Man παραδοθήσεται <WG3860> paradothēsetai will be delivered over τοῖς <WG3588> tois to the ἀρχιερεῦσιν <WG749> archiereusin chief priests καὶ <WG2532> kai and γραμματεῦσιν <WG1122> grammateusin scribes . καὶ <WG2532> kai - κατακρινοῦσιν <WG2632> katakrinousin They will condemn αὐτὸν <WG846> auton Him 〈εἰς〉 <WG1519> eis to θανάτῳ* <WG2288> thanatō death

καὶ <WG2532> kai and παραδώσουσιν <WG3860> paradōsousin will deliver αὐτὸν <WG846> auton Him over τοῖς <WG3588> tois the ἔθνεσιν <WG1484> ethnesin Gentiles εἰς <WG1519> eis to τὸ <WG3588> to - ἐμπαῖξαι <WG1702> empaixai to be mocked καὶ <WG2532> kai and μαστιγῶσαι <WG3146> mastigōsai flogged καὶ <WG2532> kai and σταυρῶσαι <WG4717> staurōsai crucified . καὶ <WG2532> kai And τῇ <WG3588> tē on the τρίτῃ <WG5154> tritē third ἡμέρᾳ <WG2250> hēmera day ἐγερθήσεται <WG1453> egerthēsetai He will be raised [to life] . ”

( A Mother’s Request) ( ( 480 10:35-45 )) Τότε <WG5119> Tote Then προσῆλθεν <WG4334> prosēlthen came αὐτῷ <WG846> autō to [Jesus] ἡ <WG3588> hē the μήτηρ <WG3384> mētēr mother τῶν <WG3588> tōn - υἱῶν <WG5207> huiōn sons Ζεβεδαίου <WG2199> Zebedaiou of Zebedee’s μετὰ <WG3326> meta with τῶν <WG3588> tōn - υἱῶν <WG5207> huiōn sons αὐτῆς <WG846> autēs her προσκυνοῦσα <WG4352> proskynousa [and] knelt down καὶ <WG2532> kai - αἰτοῦσά <WG154> aitousa to make a request τι <WG5100> ti . . . ἀπ’ <WG575> ap’ of αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou Him .

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de - εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen He inquired αὐτῇ <WG846> autē - . Τί <WG5101> Ti “ What θέλεις <WG2309> theleis do you want ? ” Λέγει <WG3004> Legei She answered αὐτῷ <WG846> autō . . . , Εἰπὲ <WG2036> Eipe “ Declare ἵνα <WG2443> hina that καθίσωσιν <WG2523> kathisōsin may sit οὗτοι <WG3778> houtoi of these οἱ <WG3588> hoi - δύο <WG1417> dyo two υἱοί <WG5207> huioi sons μου <WG1473> mou of mine εἷς <WG1520> heis one ἐκ <WG1537> ek at δεξιῶν <WG1188> dexiōn right hand , ‹σου› <WG4771> sou Your καὶ <WG2532> kai and εἷς <WG1520> heis [the other] ἐξ <WG1537> ex at εὐωνύμων <WG2176> euōnymōn left . ” σου <WG4771> sou Your ἐν <WG1722> en in τῇ <WG3588> tē - βασιλείᾳ <WG932> basileia kingdom σου <WG4771> sou Your

Ἀποκριθεὶς <WG611> Apokritheis replied δὲ <WG1161> de - ὁ <WG3588> ho - Ἰησοῦς <WG2424> Iēsous Jesus εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen - . Οὐκ <WG3756> Ouk “ vvv οἴδατε <WG1492> oidate You do not know τί <WG5101> ti what αἰτεῖσθε <WG154> aiteisthe you are asking , ” δύνασθε <WG1410> dynasthe “ Can you πιεῖν <WG4095> piein drink τὸ <WG3588> to the ποτήριον <WG4221> potērion cup ὃ <WG3739> ho - ἐγὼ <WG1473> egō I μέλλω <WG3195> mellō am going πίνειν <WG4095> pinein to drink ?” ( BYZ includes or be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized. TR is similar.) Λέγουσιν <WG3004> Legousin [the brothers] answered αὐτῷ <WG846> autō . . . . Δυνάμεθα <WG1410> Dynametha “ We can , ”

Λέγει <WG3004> Legei [Jesus] said αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois - . Τὸ <WG3588> To - μὲν <WG3303> men “ vvv ποτήριόν <WG4221> potērion cup ,” ( BYZ and TR include and be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized.) μου <WG1473> mou My πίεσθε <WG4095> piesthe You will indeed drink τὸ <WG3588> to - δὲ <WG1161> de “ But καθίσαι <WG2523> kathisai to sit ἐκ <WG1537> ek at δεξιῶν <WG1188> dexiōn right μου <WG1473> mou My καὶ <WG2532> kai [or] ἐξ <WG1537> ex - εὐωνύμων <WG2176> euōnymōn left οὐκ <WG3756> ouk not ἔστιν <WG1510> estin is ἐμὸν <WG1699> emon Mine τοῦτο <WG3778> touto - δοῦναι <WG1325> dounai to grant . ἀλλ’ <WG235> all’ [These seats belong] οἷς <WG3739> hois to those for whom ἡτοίμασται <WG2090> hētoimastai has prepared them . ” ὑπὸ <WG5259> hypo - τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Πατρός <WG3962> Patros Father μου <WG1473> mou My

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai When ἀκούσαντες <WG191> akousantes heard about [this] , οἱ <WG3588> hoi the δέκα <WG1176> deka ten ἠγανάκτησαν <WG23> ēganaktēsan they were indignant περὶ <WG4012> peri with τῶν <WG3588> tōn the δύο <WG1417> dyo two ἀδελφῶν <WG80> adelphōn brothers .

ὁ <WG3588> ho - δὲ <WG1161> de But Ἰησοῦς <WG2424> Iēsous Jesus προσκαλεσάμενος <WG4341> proskalesamenos called them aside αὐτοὺς <WG846> autous . . . εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen [and] said , Οἴδατε <WG1492> Oidate “ You know ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that οἱ <WG3588> hoi the ἄρχοντες <WG758> archontes rulers τῶν <WG3588> tōn of the ἐθνῶν <WG1484> ethnōn Gentiles κατακυριεύουσιν <WG2634> katakyrieuousin lord it over αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn them , καὶ <WG2532> kai and οἱ <WG3588> hoi [their] μεγάλοι <WG3173> megaloi superiors κατεξουσιάζουσιν <WG2715> katexousiazousin exercise authority over αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn them .

οὐχ <WG3756> ouch vvv οὕτως <WG3779> houtōs this way ἔσται* <WG1510> estai It shall not be ἐν <WG1722> en among ὑμῖν <WG4771> hymin you . ἀλλ’ <WG235> all’ Instead , ὃς <WG3739> hos whoever ἐὰν <WG1437> ean . . . θέλῃ <WG2309> thelē wants ἐν <WG1722> en among ὑμῖν <WG4771> hymin you μέγας <WG3173> megas great γενέσθαι <WG1096> genesthai to become ἔσται <WG1510> estai must be ὑμῶν <WG4771> hymōn your διάκονος <WG1249> diakonos servant ,

καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὃς <WG3739> hos whoever ἂν <WG302> an . . . θέλῃ <WG2309> thelē wants ἐν <WG1722> en among ὑμῖν <WG4771> hymin you εἶναι <WG1510> einai to be πρῶτος <WG4413> prōtos first ἔσται <WG1510> estai must be ὑμῶν <WG4771> hymōn your δοῦλος <WG1401> doulos slave —

ὥσπερ <WG5618> hōsper just as ὁ <WG3588> ho the Υἱὸς <WG5207> Huios Son τοῦ <WG3588> tou - ἀνθρώπου <WG444> anthrōpou of Man οὐκ <WG3756> ouk vvv ἦλθεν <WG2064> ēlthen did not come διακονηθῆναι <WG1247> diakonēthēnai to be served , ἀλλὰ <WG235> alla but διακονῆσαι <WG1247> diakonēsai to serve , καὶ <WG2532> kai and δοῦναι <WG1325> dounai to give τὴν <WG3588> tēn - ψυχὴν <WG5590> psychēn life αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou His λύτρον <WG3083> lytron [as] a ransom ἀντὶ <WG473> anti for πολλῶν <WG4183> pollōn many . ”

( The Blind Men by the Road) ( ( 480 10:46-52 ; 490 18:35-43 )) Καὶ <WG2532> Kai - ἐκπορευομένων <WG1607> ekporeuomenōn were leaving αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn [As] they ἀπὸ <WG575> apo . . . Ἰεριχὼ <WG2410> Ierichō Jericho , ἠκολούθησεν <WG190> ēkolouthēsen followed αὐτῷ <WG846> autō Him . ὄχλος <WG3793> ochlos crowd πολύς <WG4183> polys a large

καὶ <WG2532> kai And ἰδοὺ <WG2400> idou there were δύο <WG1417> dyo two τυφλοὶ <WG5185> typhloi blind [men] καθήμενοι <WG2521> kathēmenoi sitting παρὰ <WG3844> para beside τὴν <WG3588> tēn the ὁδόν <WG3598> hodon road . ἀκούσαντες <WG191> akousantes When they heard ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that Ἰησοῦς <WG2424> Iēsous Jesus παράγει <WG3855> paragei was passing by , ἔκραξαν <WG2896> ekraxan they cried out λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes . . . , Κύριε <WG2962> Kyrie “ Lord , «ἐλέησον <WG1653> eleēson have mercy on ἡμᾶς» <WG1473> hēmas us ! ” υἱὸς <WG5207> huios Son Δαυίδ <WG1138> Dauid of David ,

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho The δὲ <WG1161> de - ὄχλος <WG3793> ochlos crowd ἐπετίμησεν <WG2008> epetimēsen admonished αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois them ἵνα <WG2443> hina - σιωπήσωσιν <WG4623> siōpēsōsin to be silent , οἱ <WG3588> hoi - δὲ <WG1161> de but μεῖζον <WG3173> meizon all the louder ἔκραξαν <WG2896> ekraxan they cried out λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes - , Κύριε <WG2962> Kyrie “ Lord , «ἐλέησον <WG1653> eleēson have mercy on ἡμᾶς» <WG1473> hēmas us ! ” υἱὸς <WG5207> huios Son Δαυίδ <WG1138> Dauid of David ,
